intro: Eriogonum latum, commonly known as the broadleaf buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, which includes other plants known for their distinctive leaf structures. Eriogonum latum plays an important role in supporting local pollinators and stabilizing soil in its native environment.
